column1: Local Foods////The place has a very hipster-y vibe. There is ample parking
column2: which is surprising given that it's near the rice village area. The food is very good as well. It's a little pricey for what it is in my opinion (sandwiches and sides) but the taste is worth it. I will say that the menu seems pretty limited for people who like meaty meals
column3: so maybe this isn't the place for meat lovers. Not that it doesn't have sandwiches with meat in it
column4: but the options aren't a lot (based on my boyfriend's reaction when he saw the menu and decided to go eat somewhere else instead).
